subject: Re: Suspicious Gecko Orders
preview: Hi Bonnie,  Perfect, that sounds like a plan!  Fingers crossed the reCAPTCHA does the trick, but if not, we’ll tackle the next step together - no stress.

full_threads.body:
Hi Bonnie,

Perfect, that sounds like a plan!

Fingers crossed the reCAPTCHA does the trick, but if not, we’ll tackle the next step together - no stress.

Hi Adriane,

I'll take your advice and see if the reCAPTCHA does the job before going ahead with the next level.

I'll let you know if we run into any issues.

Thanks

Bonnie Sudirwan

Marketing Communications Manager

Hi Bonnie,

Thanks so much for the green light! I’ve jumped straight in.

I’m setting everything up under your existing “Lion Mayohardware” Google project (keeping costs at $0), but ran into a tiny snag: the account is technically inactive because it needs a billing card linked to unlock the free credits.

Before sending you down the billing rabbit hole, I had a thought:
Since I’ve already locked down the checkout with reCAPTCHA (stopping bots and automated scripts), the “weird” address issue might actually sort itself out if it was just caused by bot traffic.

So, we have two options:
  • Wait and Watch (my recommendation): Hold off on the address plugin for now and see if the reCAPTCHA update does the trick. Saves you the admin hassle today.
  • Proceed Anyway: If you’d prefer a full safeguard against human typos, we can do the full setup. You’d just need to log into the Google Cloud Console and link a credit card to the “Lion Mayohardware” project.

One quick heads-up: I had a peek at the user list for that Google project and couldn’t see your email. If you want to go with Option 2, just let me know which email to add as an admin so you can access it.

Hi Adriane, Permission to go ahead. Please apply to the below sites:
  • Char-Griller
  • Cozze
  • Spider Tarp
  • Bug Zapper Lamps
  • Thermacell
  • Master Lock Connected
Thanks Bonnie Sudirwan Marketing Communications Manager bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au http://www.mayohardware.com.au/ 0408 331 966 Customer Service: 1300 360 211 CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information or otherwise be protected by law. Any unauthorised review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message.

Hi Bonnie,

Happy New Year! I hope you’ve had a lovely start to 2026.

You were absolutely right to flag that order - great catch. It looks like the customer’s browser autofill mashed up a US street address with her Aussie suburb (she’s likely using a forwarding service, which explains the mix-up).

I checked the Gecko site to compare, and it turns out it doesn't have an address validation plugin installed either. We’ve just been fortunate with the orders there so far.

To get this sorted for you, here is the plan:
  1. Security Update (Done): I have gone ahead and enabled reCAPTCHA on the checkout. This is strictly to stop automated bots and fraud attempts.
  2. Address Fix (Permission needed): Since reCAPTCHA only stops robots (not human errors), are you happy for me to install a proper Address Validation plugin on both Thermacell and Gecko? This is the only way to physically prevent customers from entering "impossible" addresses like this one.

In the meantime, I recommend you keep Wendy’s order on hold and reach out to her directly to get the correct street address.

If there's anything else I can help with - feel free to sing out, always happy to support!

Hi Adriane,

Happy new year! I hope you have been well.

Just wanting to make sure that the plug in you used on the Gecko website was also done on our other websites as the below is a Thermacell order and the address looks a little strange

Bonnie Sudirwan

Thank you for your prompt action on this matter.

Can you please ensure that none of the bot orders are fed through to us via the SFTP files. As our online orders are automatically sent to the warehouse, they have been working hard to pick and dispatch fraudulent orders, only to find the addresses are not real, then we need to return the products to our inventory which has put strain on our staff.

Hi Bonnie and Andrew,

Thanks for your patience - we’ve identified this as bot-driven activity targeting specific products.

We’ve now added Cloudflare Turnstile (bot protection) to the affected sites:
  • geckoinsectkillers.com.au
  • thermacellrepellents.com.au
  • cozze.com.au

We’ve checked your other websites and can confirm they’re not impacted at this stage.

This protection should significantly reduce fake and fraudulent orders. We’ll continue to keep an eye on things and let you know if anything further comes up.

Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or would like additional safeguards in place.

Hi Bonnie and Andrew,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We completely understand your concern regarding these orders.

Our team is actively investigating the Gecko Insect Killers website to determine how these US and potentially bot-generated orders were placed. We are also reviewing your other sites to ensure there is no wider impact.

We’ll provide a detailed update as soon as we have our findings and suggested next steps to prevent this from happening again.

In the meantime, if you notice any additional unusual orders, please let us know so we can include them in our investigation.

Hello Bonnie, thank you for identifying this issue.

action.text: Adriane Roa assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Hi team,

We have received 4 successful orders placed for customers with US delivery details. We have since refunded these customers and cancelled their orders as we do not ship outside Australia. I do not know how people outside Australia are placing orders. Can you please investigate this?

While I was trying to investigate this myself, I have noticed that we have received 19,570 failed fake orders that date back to the 21st of September 2025. Majority of them failed as the payments were declined, however, I have noticed that some have been successful. Below is a snippet of the most recent examples of successful orders. It appears to be orders that come from an 'Unknown' origin, and as you can see, they are likely spam-ordering using bots:



If you view the order details, they are obviously fake as 1. The phone numbers are not Australian and 2. The emails appear to be auto generated. Every order is for 1x replacement globe and the total value with shipping is always $14.64

Can you please investigate this as a matter of urgency with a solution, as I am concerned people's payment details are being used fraudulently on our website. I have checked our other sites and it appears to only be happening on https://geckoinsectkillers.com.au/

Thanks

Bonnie Sudirwan
 ​​​​
Marketing Communications Manager


bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au

www.mayohardware.com.au

+61 0408331966

Customer Service: 1300 360 211
